text: hey there fellow travelers mark here
with Walters world and we're in Rome
today we're in the Piazza Navona and
people of Asti mark have you seen much
kind of impact of the the Syrian migrant
crisis in Europe well in the last year
we've been to France twice Italy three
times Germany Austria Sweden Norway
Portugal and I'm here in Rome right now
and it's spring 2016 and really I have
not seen any problems or any issues with
me traveling I've talked to other
travelers they haven't had any issues I
will say I have seen an increased amount
of security at different sites you know
here you see some military guys behind
me and more police walking around and
covering Yeti and a lot other places
I've seen some more checks at train
stations whereas if you were going to
get on the train maybe they don't let
you get on to the platform until you
show your ticket in some places but
overall I haven't seen much impact at
all so if you're really worried about
the Syrian migrant crisis affecting your
vacation to Europe I don't think it's
gonna be an issue
I haven't seen anything and we've been
traveling for a year with this and
honestly I haven't seen much I have
talked to locals and they say no we
don't really have many issues but it's
probably because it's not in the tourist
areas where the people end up
it's an outlying areas so as a tourist
you probably are not gonna be affected
anyway I hope that answers your question
makes you feel better about coming to
Europe because it is still worth
beggarman to see don't worry about that
and I'll say ciao from Piazza Navona in
Rome ah my
